intro: Dumasia villosa subsp. leiocarpa, commonly known as the silky dumasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
